thread.title: Death In Paradise viewers divided over Jack Mooney as detective replaces Humphrey Goodman
thread.title_full: Death In Paradise viewers divided over Jack Mooney as detective replaces Humphrey Goodman

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Death In Paradise viewers divided over Jack Mooney as detective replaces Humphrey Goodman
text:
Death In Paradise viewers divided over Jack Mooney as detective replaces Humphrey Goodman Many fans were impressed with the newcomer - others weren't quite convinced Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Viewers split about new detective in Death in Paradise Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Death in Paradise had a new detective inspector as Jack Mooney took the hot seat after Humphrey Goodman's final appearance last week. 
It was all changed for the BBC favourite on Thursday night, as new star Ardal O'Hanlon brought his character to life following the departure of Kris Marshall. 
Viewers couldn't quite seem to make up their minds during the final episode of the series, with many voicing their approval over the newcomer, while others were clearly still missing Goodman. Ardal split viewers on Thursday night (Photo: BBC) DI Jack Mooney took the lead (Photo: BBC) 
Summing up the collective reaction, one viewer tweeted: "Not sure how I feel about DI Jack Mooney #deathinparadise" Read More 
Others were somewhat stronger in their stance, with one hinting that the show "is just not the same" without Marshall leading the way. Some viewers were clearly longing for the past (Photo: BBC) Others are excited for the future (Photo: BBC) 
"I like Ardal O'Hanlon, but I just can't get into this Jack moony character. #deathinparadise (sic)," tweeted a different viewer. Read More 
Another added: "Don't like This new lead character he's not a great actor not even a good one great for comedy just no gravitas (sic)" Kris Marshall quit the show (Photo: BBC) 
However, many others heaped praised on O'Hanlon as he took the lead and suggested he was just what the show needed. 
Echoing the thoughts of a large number of viewers, one said: "Love Jack on #DeathInParadise exactly what the show needed" Like us on Facebook
